adjective.description: (of a person's memory) having the ability to remember facts and impressions easily.
examples: he had a highly retentive memory and was an accomplished speaker

adjective.description: (of a substance) able to absorb and hold moisture.
examples: soil should be rich and moisture retentive

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French retentif, -ive or medieval Latin retentivus, from retent- held back, from the verb retinere (see retain).
